file_content.text: Hello again! No rescuers yet, but they'll be along.
You leave, you come back! Stop it!
Good, good, you're back. And--so Doctor Kerrian gave you his holojournal after all.
Unfortunately, I was forced to kill him.
I'm afraid he's dead.
Doctor Kerrian too, huh. That makes his journal even more important.
I must hear the information on this journal, immediately.
Please play it.
It was rather a struggle to make him part with it.
In a manner of speaking.
Let me see. Please don't be encrypted....
...wandering off. This team's eccentricities are getting unbearable. The Deep Cradle's secrets should make up for it.
It started like that. Here, the next entry's a few days later.
...following me about. I led them here, and now they're nameless.
A switch, a little switch, behind the cradle's third stone. Ugh, I can't think here! Now, where did I leave my study?
Mad thing spoke of switch.
I believe I heard the word "switch" amongst his rantings.
Hey, he said something about a switch.
So Doctor Kerrian found the way. Secret switch.
Listen, he said "switch."
A switch to unseal. First, the ritual. Or madness. Talan-De at the outpost will show.
You've completed this rite, what can I expect?
Lefry, what's the ritual like?
The commando said I wasn't to tell anyone about... wait a second.
Yes, with respect, Lefry, I don't want to end up like your colleagues.
Good point.
The Deep Cradle's secret. Its altars grant enlightenment.
I don't want to leave Lefry here alone.
We should take Lefry with us.
No! I'm not going out there again. Jedi, you can't leave.
Ki-Da's ritual should protect us, but we must be vigilant.
Watch for signs of madness.
I trust you can meditate at speed. Let's go.
As long as you're quick.
No, you can't leave, not both of you. I'll be alone.
Maybe I can send a distress signal, but how long before I'm rescued? And what if the ritual wears off?
The Deep Cradle isn't going anywhere. We'll stay here until rescue arrives.
I'll wait with you.
You'd do that for me? Oh, thank you--I'll send the signal right now!
...and then one night, there was this sort of crackling noise to the east, but whenever we got up, it went quiet again....
Soft thing's tales have no end, Herald.
It's nice to take a little break.
Yes, with your audio receiver turned down, I imagine it's quite pleasant.
Pardon?
All right, that's it, I'm walking perimeter for a while.
Five minutes, I'll have a makeshift gag, Jedi.
Actually, these lands remind me a bit of the forests back home. Only, worse.
I do not like his stories.
Hello? We got a distress call and--are you the only survivors?
There was an incident, and Doctor Kerrian's team is gone. This man needs escorting home.
I'm afraid so.
I have other business here, but this man needs to be returned to Voss-Ka.
Please escort Lefry home.
Finally. Get Lefry here back to Voss-Ka; we're leaving.
You took your time.
He'll be safe with us, Master Jedi.
Wait. Here--I found this near the Deep Cradle. It looks kind of valuable. Take it, please.
Such generosity is unnecessary, but I appreciate it.
Thank you.
I can't accept this.
Then give it to your order or something.
I'll consider it compensation for the time I've wasted.
I think I've earned it.
Goodbye! Thanks for everything.
You show great patience. Be sure of the path, then call. I follow.
You aren't scared. You're going to be calm, cheerful and sane, until help arrives.
[Force Persuade] Be brave.
I guess I can stay calm, cheerful and sane until rescue arrives.
Take whatever supplies you need. I'll settle down with a book until the Republic sends someone. Good luck!
Solve that yourself.
No, please don't go!
When path is clear, call. I follow.
Did you hear that? No, never mind. Did you get the holojournal?
Whisper all you like! La la la. They gave me a palace on Alsakan / I'd prefer a ditch on Alderaan.
Calm yourself. I am a Jedi Master, no harm will come to you.
Be at peace.
Sophia Farash sent me.
I don't have time for self-indulgent, demented whining. Or singing.
Shut up!
I'm not listening! I'm... not....
You're... a real Jedi. I thought the madness had finally gotten to me.
I'm Lefry, an excavator. The ritual saved me, but the team... everything's gone wrong.
Why didn't they attack you?
I'm amazed you're still alive.
I guess they still recognized me. They didn't do anything, just... whispered. Over and over.
I was sent to protect you and your team.
I was supposed to save them.
You couldn't have. This... was everyone. Apart from Doctor Kerrian.
I hope Doctor Kerrian isn't among the dead.
I need Kerrian's directions.
No. He's run off.
The Voss said some ritual could protect us in the ruins. I figured, well, they'd know, so a Voss commando helped me do it.
But Doctor Kerrian said there wasn't time for everyone to "see the native puppet show." He wanted to explore the Dark Heart.
Talan-De told me how to resist the Dark Heart's madness.
I know of it, and the ritual.
What is the Dark Heart?
The Dark Heart?
The oldest ruin around here.
He sacrificed his whole team for impatience.
And this is the consequence.
If you obsess over every local custom, you'll never get anything done.
Doctor Kerrian had a point.
The Dark Heart. A part is the Deep Cradle.
Deep... Cradle? Yes, that's the part of the ruin Doctor Kerrian wanted to get into, but it's all sealed up.
We spent days trying to open it, then suddenly the... the madness started. Doctor Kerrian ran off. The others stayed and... stared at me.
If the doctor knows about the Deep Cradle, I need to find him.
Where is Doctor Kerrian now?
A horrible ordeal.
I can't think about it. Only Doctor Kerrian had any idea how to get the Deep Cradle open.
You've been to the ruins, you must know how to get in. Come on.
Take me to the Deep Cradle.
But I told you, it's sealed up. Only Doctor Kerrian had any idea how to open it.
I can't let you go after him. Please, don't leave.
I will be here.
You'll stay? Okay. I'll track the doctor's locator, but he's, you know, not a person anymore.
Though, if he still has his holojournal, his field notes should be in there.
With luck, it hasn't been lost in the wilderness.
I hope he still has it.
I'll be right back.
At the first sign of any insanity from this man, run. I'll find you later.
Be careful, Gaden-Ko.
I understand.
If you can get his holojournal, I'll play it for you. And hurry.
We wait.
Goodbye, Lefry.
